description: From Middle English flendris, of North Germanic origin, from or related to Norwegian flindra, from Proto-Germanic *flintaz, from Proto-Indo-European *splind- (“to split, cleave”).

entries.meaning: A small piece or fragment; a thin slice; splinter

description: From Middle English flindre. Compare Dutch vlinder.

verbs.description: flinder (third-person singular simple present flinders, present participle flindering, simple past and past participle flindered)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To flirt; run about in a fluttering manner
